result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristine A. Talsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**No days credit, if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CM381

miscConds.notes:
No contact with any Walmart locations. 
No intentional contact with T.H., J.H. or their residence(s).

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Court orders Probation may end after 12 months per agent, if Restitution and fees/fines are paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristine A. Talsky

defendant.name: Talsky, Kristine A.
defendant.address: 103 E Lexington Blvd, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $532.21
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Retail Theft.

(Cases 21CM381, 22CF76 are called at 11:02 AM) Defendant Kristine A. Talsky in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Keith Murphy in court for Kristine A. Talsky.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CM381 Count 2- Obstructing an Officer as a Party to a Crime and 22CF76 amended Count 1- Misdemeanor Retail Theft. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation with the following conditions: 30 days jail with Huber on 21CM381 Count 2, all stayed pending further order of the court; No contact with any Walmart locations; No intentional contact with T.H., J.H. or their residence(s); Restitution in the amount of $532.21 plus %10 surcharge in 22CF76; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders if the Restitution and fees/fines are paid in full and complying with Probation conditions, Probation may end after 12 months. Court orders no credit, if revoked.

1:37 PM cases 22CF76 and 21CM381 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kristine A. Talsky appeared in court, Attorney Brian Keith Murphy appeared in court for Kristine A. Talsky. In felony file: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
In 21CM381 parties agree to remove the jury trial from the court's calendar in anticipation of a global plea offer. Parties discuss bond conditions. 
Both files: A plea hearing is to be scheduled with Branch 1 judicial assistant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 11:34 AM.
Defendant Kristine A. Talsky appeared in court without counsel, Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Hearing: 2/24/22 at 1:30 PM (Br 4).
